text: It's a drinks stall at a coffee shop, but with a wide variety of different alcohols for the picking. Don't expect good service, given that it's like I said, like a coffee shop. Prices are fair, great for after work drinks if you're working in the area. We got ourselves some Guiness draught on tap. 3 for 33, one drink before heading home.
There was a pretty good selection of craft beers and the cocktails were quite affordable. For instance, you can get two decent gin-and-tonics for only $22. Staff were friendly too.

Love the supermarket concept of a walk in beer shop. Choose and pay at counter.

Cashier was also on his toes as he alerted me that the drink I chose was non-alcoholic, in case I wanted a beer :)

But yes, it was the tea I was after....
Nice place for a drink. Lots of choices on craft beers.

Was drawn by the seemingly wide selection of craft beer, but thereâ€™s only 4 very normal beer/stout on draft. Staff are unfriendly and treat you as if they are doing you a favor. Prices are expensive too. No reason to patronise them again.
